Title:
A new species of Xenasmatella (Polyporales, Basidiomycota) on
rotten bamboo from southern China
Keywords:
Polypore, taxonomy, three new taxa, wood-rotting
fungi
Abstract:
A new wood-inhabiting fungus in the order Polyporales,
Xenasmatella roseobubalina sp. nov., is described and illustrated from
China based on morphological and molecular evidence. The species was
found in Yunnan Province, and grows on the undersides of a rotten
bamboo. X. roseobubalina is characterized by annual, resupinate
basidioma with a pinkish buff hymenophore, a monomitic hyphal system,
generative hyphae thin-walled with clamp connections, the presence of
voluminous crystalline among hyphae, theabsence of cystidia and
cystidioles, and broadly ellipsoid to subglobose basidiospores measuring
3.85 × 3.34 μm. The phylogenetic analysis based on the nuc rDNA
ITS1-5.8S-ITS2 (ITS) dataset shows that the new species belongs to
Xenasmatella. The difference between X. roseobubalina and other members
of the genus are discussed. In addition, two new combinations, X.
gossypina and X. wuliangshanensis, are also proposed.
